Otto and Elise Hampel had been secretly and peacefully protesting against Adolf Hitler and the Nazi party, clandestinely handing out postcards around their neighbourhood decrying the fascist regime.
German resistance historian Nathan Stoltzfus talks about the importance of their protest in this interview.

WRITING.TEXT: It wasn't an ideal gig venue - the stage setup didn't always guarantee a great atmosphere with noise from the bar and the karaoke crowd - but it was one of the few small places still putting on new and touring bands. There's a real lack of those types of places now, sadly.
I think they're just confirming the closing date now
